html: Those who gather others and present them as offerings to Jehovah (v 20) are ordained his priests as were his servants (Isaiah 61:3, 6, 10). Under the terms of the Davidic Covenant, however, they additionally assume the role of kings who serve as proxy saviors of their peoples (cf. Isaiah 49:22-23; 55:3; 65:8-9). In the “consummation of the earth” that constitutes Jehovah’s “glory,” therefore (Isaiah 6:3), those who attain the highest spiritual levels serve as kings and priests, inheriting the blessings of both the Davidic and Levitical Covenants (Jeremiah 33:20-22; Revelation 20:6; cf. Genesis 14:18).
